Name: Seal of Petenisis
Description: This imprint of a seal in clay is part of a category of objects seemingly bearing an inscription with the royal name of Amasis preceded by the "sa"-sign(=protection) and followed by the name and title of the owner. The piece form Brussels is in the name of Petensis, also known by his tomb to the south-east of the pyramid of Unas. This person, who seems to have been assigned to the royal treasury, probably lived under the reign of Amasis, the penultimate king of the 26th Dynasty.
